title: Cheating in Sports
task_instruction: Read a text about cheating in sports, and for questions 1 to 8, choose the correct answer.

passages.title: What Counts as Cheating?
passages.text: Anyone who loves sports will agree that cheating is bad. For example, it was wrong for Spain to include players who were not actually disabled in the 2000 Sydney Paralympics basketball team. However, sometimes it is hard to decide what is cheating and what is not. Many sports encourage players to be 'sporting' – to play honestly and accept losing. But the rewards for winning can be great, so it is natural for players to find different ways to win. Sometimes they bend the rules or cheat to get an advantage.

passages.title: Gamesmanship
passages.text: Gamesmanship is when you try to win by bending the rules or using doubtful tactics. For example, at the 2012 Olympics, British cyclist Philip Hindes had a bad start in a team race. Knowing that if a rider fell early the race would be restarted, he crashed his bike on purpose. Britain went on to win gold.

passages.title: Psychological Tactics
passages.text: Other examples of gamesmanship include faking injuries or wasting time. This can give players a rest or annoy their opponents, affecting their concentration. At the 2016 Rio Olympics, badminton player Carolina Marins shouted every time her opponent made a mistake. This upset her opponent, but Marins won gold without breaking any rules.

passages.title: The Role of Referees
passages.text: In unclear situations, it is the referee’s job to decide if cheating is happening. Players can take advantage because referees can’t see everything. For example, in cricket, if the ball hits a batter’s legs, he is out. Most batters know when they are out, but they often wait for the umpire’s decision in case it goes in their favour. This is not considered cheating.

passages.title: Famous Cases
passages.text: In the 1986 World Cup, Diego Maradona scored a goal with his hand. The referee didn’t see it, and Maradona didn’t admit it. In contrast, in the 2002 World Cup, Rivaldo faked an injury but was caught and fined.

passages.title: Losing on Purpose
passages.text: At the 2012 London Olympics, four women’s badminton doubles teams from China, Indonesia, and South Korea purposely played badly to get an easier match later. They broke no rules but were disqualified for poor sportsmanship.

passages.title: A Question to Consider
passages.text: Where there are games, people will try different ways to win. But is bending the rules the same as cheating, or does it just make the game more interesting?

questions.question: Why was Spain’s basketball team in the 2000 Sydney Paralympics criticised?
options: Because they cheated during a match
Because they included players who were not disabled
Because they refused to play fairly
Because they won unfairly against the host team
questions.answer: Because they included players who were not disabled

questions.question: What is gamesmanship?
options: Breaking all the rules to win
Trying to win by bending the rules
Winning without using any tactics
Using only fair play
questions.answer: Trying to win by bending the rules

questions.question: Why did Philip Hindes crash his bike in the 2012 Olympics?
options: Because he had a mechanical problem
Because he wanted to restart the race
Because he was injured
Because he wanted to avoid finishing last
questions.answer: Because he wanted to restart the race

questions.question: How did Carolina Marins affect her opponent in the 2016 Rio Olympics?
options: By shouting to upset her opponent
By faking an injury
By wasting time
By playing slowly
questions.answer: By shouting to upset her opponent

questions.question: Why do some cricketers wait for the umpire’s decision even when they know they are out?
options: Because it’s part of the game’s strategy
Because they want to challenge the umpire
Because they hope the umpire might not notice
Because they are not sure if they are out
questions.answer: Because they hope the umpire might not notice

questions.question: How did Maradona cheat in the 1986 World Cup?
options: By scoring a goal with his hand
By faking an injury
By wasting time
By distracting the referee
questions.answer: By scoring a goal with his hand

questions.question: Why were four badminton teams disqualified at the 2012 London Olympics?
options: Because they played too aggressively
Because they broke equipment
Because they purposely lost to get easier matches
Because they refused to play
questions.answer: Because they purposely lost to get easier matches

questions.question: What question does the text leave for the reader?
options: Should all sports be fair?
Is bending the rules the same as cheating?
Can sports be played without rules?
Should referees be removed from games?
questions.answer: Is bending the rules the same as cheating?
